name: Sadagaat
mission: Sadagaat seeks to contribute to improving the educational services of the poor segments by focusing on the education of special groups (children who are not enrolled in schools and the blind), in addition to improving the educational environment, building the capacities of the educational staff, and providing opportunities for professional education.
theoryOfChange: Empowering marginalized communities through a combination of immediate emergency relief (food/water) and sustainable development (education/infrastructure) to break the cycle of poverty.
zakatClaimEvidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://sadagaat-usa.org/giving/zakat (Source: https://sadagaat-usa.org/giving/zakat)

components.evidence: Explicit zakat program (+4); Muslim-focused organization (+2); Asnaf: fuqara (+5); Operates in Muslim-majority regions (+3); Strong humanitarian service (+4)
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

components.improvement_suggestion: Expand services to underserved populations or regions with limited nonprofit coverage
components.name: Underserved Space

alignment.rationale: Alignment 43/50: HIGH Muslim donor fit, humanitarian cause area

components.improvement_suggestion: Document a clear theory of change with causal pathway
components.name: Theory of Change

judge_issues.message: Jargon detected in baseline narrative: 'asnaf categories'

score_details.score_summary: SADAGAAT-USA earns 86/100 due to exceptional impact and exceptional alignment, with zakat compliance.

zakat.claim_evidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://sadagaat-usa.org/giving/zakat (Source: https://sadagaat-usa.org/giving/zakat)

all_citations.claim: SADAGAAT-USA holds a Charity Navigator score of 97.5/100 and maintains a 98.4% program expense ratio.
The organization is Zakat-eligible and maintains a specific zakat policy for asnaf categories.
The organization reported total revenue of $1,294,453 and fundraising efficiency of $0.01 per $1 raised.
SADAGAAT-USA focuses on education for special groups and operates in health, feeding, and water sectors.
The organization is a registered entity focused on improving educational environments and staff capacity.
The organization provides opportunities for professional education and community fundraising.
SADAGAAT-USA offers various volunteer opportunities and engagement methods for supporters.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: With a Charity Navigator score of 97.5/100 and a GMG score of 86/100, SADAGAAT-USA demonstrates elite financial transparency and operational efficiency [1]. Its direct provision model ensures high impact for humanitarian causes [4].
areas_for_improvement: Working capital reserves are relatively lean at 3.6 months, which may limit long-term financial cushioning.
Expansion of third-party impact evaluations could further validate the cost-per-beneficiary metrics.

dimension_explanations.alignment: SADAGAAT-USA shows strong alignment with humanitarian urgency and Muslim donor needs, as it is officially Zakat-eligible [2]. The organization also offers diverse engagement opportunities through volunteering and community-led fundraising [6][8].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization achieves high impact through a direct provision model, maintaining a total revenue of $1,294,453 with a 98.4% program expense ratio [1][3]. Its focus on specialized education and essential infrastructure like water and health services provides measurable outcomes for the poor [4][6].

baseline_narrative.headline: SADAGAAT-USA empowers vulnerable communities through high-impact humanitarian programs in health, education, and water infrastructure.
strengths: Exceptional program expense ratio of 98.4%, ensuring nearly all funds directly support charitable activities.
Highly efficient fundraising operations, spending only $0.01 to raise every $1.
Verified Zakat-eligible status with clear policies for asnaf categories.
baseline_narrative.summary: SADAGAAT-USA is a non-profit organization dedicated to improving educational services for marginalized groups, including children not enrolled in school and the visually impaired [4][5]. The organization operates comprehensive programs across the health care, feeding, and water sectors to foster sustainable development for poor segments of society [4][6].

case_against.summary: Limited concerns exist, primarily centered on the <cite id="14">developing nature of their formal Theory of Change</cite> and geographic concentration.

alignment.improvement: Alignment could be enhanced by <cite id="15">expanding services to more underserved regions</cite> with limited nonprofit coverage.

credibility.explanation: Donors can trust this charity due to its <cite id="8">97.5/100 rating from Charity Navigator</cite>, its <cite id="10">100% independent board</cite>, and its status as a <cite id="17">Candid Platinum Seal holder</cite>.
credibility.improvement: To strengthen credibility further, the charity could publish more detailed third-party impact evaluations.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who prioritize maximum financial efficiency and want their zakat to directly fund humanitarian relief and specialized education in Sudan.
donor_motivations: Want to ensure 100% of their donation reaches the field
Care about the humanitarian crisis and educational gaps in Sudan
Value high-transparency organizations with Platinum-level reporting
Seek to fulfill zakat through a verified, high-scoring charity
giving_considerations: The 100% program ratio is rare and indicates extremely lean US operations
Focus is highly specific to Sudan, which may be a pro or con depending on donor intent
Rapid growth (33.4% CAGR) suggests a high capacity to absorb new funding
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking domestic US-based community programs or those looking for broad global geographic diversification.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade B reflects consistent outcome tracking and a high impact score, though a formal causal pathway document is still developing.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: The organization combats the cycle of poverty, ignorance, and disease through direct provision of water, health, and education services.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that the $0.15 spent per beneficiary translates into long-term improvements in health and literacy.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: With a 33.4% growth rate and deep humanitarian needs in Sudan, the organization has significant capacity to scale.
strategic_priorities: Expanding educational access for the blind

strengths.detail: The organization operates with a <cite id="3">98.4% program expense ratio</cite> and spends only <cite id="7">$0.01 to raise every $1</cite>, maximizing the impact of every donation.
SADAGAAT-USA holds a <cite id="8">97.5/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite> and has earned the Candid Platinum Seal of Transparency.
The charity achieves an <cite id="9">exceptional cost-per-beneficiary of $0.15</cite> within its humanitarian programs.

strengths_deep_dive: SADAGAAT-USA's financial health is bolstered by a <cite id="10">100% independent board</cite> and a lean operational model that maintains <cite id="11">3.6 months of working capital</cite>. This stability allows them to sustain long-term projects in Sudan, such as water infrastructure and specialized education, while maintaining a <cite id="12">perfect 100 score in Leadership</cite> metrics. Their commitment to transparency is further evidenced by <cite id="13">tracking three distinct outcome metrics</cite> through Candid, providing donors with verifiable data on program success.
rich_narrative.summary: SADAGAAT-USA is a high-impact humanitarian organization dedicated to empowering vulnerable communities through critical interventions in health, education, and infrastructure. The organization has demonstrated significant growth, reporting <cite id="1">$1,294,453 in total revenue</cite> for the 2023 fiscal year, representing a <cite id="2">33.4% three-year revenue CAGR</cite>. Their operations are characterized by an <cite id="3">exceptional program expense ratio of 98.4%</cite>, ensuring that every dollar donated is directed toward service delivery rather than administrative overhead. Based in the United States but primarily serving Sudan, the charity focuses on the "vicious cycle of Poverty - Ignorance - Disease" by providing <cite id="4">direct provision of services</cite> across five core sectors: Feeding, Water, Health, Education, and Crisis Relief. Their educational initiatives are particularly specialized, focusing on <cite id="5">children not enrolled in schools and the visually impaired</cite>. The organization maintains a <cite id="6">perfect 100 score for Culture and Leadership</cite> from Charity Navigator, reflecting a strong organizational foundation and strategic clarity in its mission to serve the underprivileged.
